alert.note: Alert for Albany (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 2:29PM MDT until June 12 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Mullen Burn Scar above Albany and Woods Landing in... Southwestern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 229 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Mullen Burn Scar above Albany and Woods Landing. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar may result in debris flow moving through the Muddy and Squirrel Creeks. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. in and around the Mullen Burn Scar above Albany and Woods Landing. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Mullen Burn Scar above Albany and Woods Landing. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albany, Lake Owen, Lake Owen Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm and Woods Landing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
